The 'Danube' ( ) is a river in Central Europe, the continent's second longest
after the Volga.

Classified as an international waterway, it originates in the town of
Donaueschingen which is in the Black Forest of Germany at the confluence of the
rivers Brigach and Breg. The Danube then flows southeast for , passing through
four Central European capitals before emptying into the Black Sea via the Danube
Delta in Romania and Ukraine.

Once a long-standing frontier of the Roman Empire, the river passes through or
touches the borders of ten countries: Romania (29.0% of basin area), Hungary
(11.6%), Serbia (10.2%), Austria (10.0%), Germany (7.0%), Bulgaria (5.9%),
Slovakia (5.9%), Croatia (4.4%), Ukraine (3.8%), and Moldova (1.6%). Its drainage basin extends into nine more.
